wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant-Colonel Frederick Miller VC (10 November 1831 – 17 February 1874) was an English recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

link_mentions.page: List of English Victoria Cross recipients
response: |Frederick Miller ||  British Army|| 1854 || Crimean War || Inkerman
Frederick Miller was the founder of Miller Brewing Company.
Frederick Miller may also refer to:
*Frederick Miller (British journalist) (1863–1924), British journalist and editor of The Daily Telegraph
